intro: Visnaga, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Visnaga is known for its latex-rich sap, which has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important plant in its native habitats.
